intro: Arnebia nandadeviensis, commonly known as the Nanda Devi bloodroot, is a rare flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a rough texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
